verses.text: And they bring in the ark of God, and set it up in the midst of the tent that David hath stretched out for it, and they bring near burnt-offerings and peace-offerings before God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and David ceaseth from offering the burnt-offering and the peace-offerings, and blesseth the people in the name of Jehovah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and giveth a portion to every man of Israel, both man and woman: to each a cake of bread, and a measure of wine, and a grape-cake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he putteth before the ark of Jehovah, of the Levites, ministers, even to make mention of, and to thank, and to give praise to Jehovah, God of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Asaph the head, and his second Zechariah; Jeiel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehiel, and Mattithiah, and Eliab, and Benaiah, and Obed-Edom, and Jeiel, with instruments of psalteries, and with harps; and Asaph with cymbals is sounding;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Benaiah and Jahaziel the priests [are] with trumpets continually before the ark of the covenant of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day then hath David given at the beginning to give thanks to Jehovah by the hand of Asaph and his brethren: --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give thanks to Jehovah, call in His name, Make known among the peoples His doings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sing ye to Him, sing psalms to Him, Meditate on all His wonders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Boast yourselves in His holy name, Rejoice doth the heart of those seeking Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seek ye Jehovah and His strength, Seek His face continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember His wonders that He did, His signs, and the judgments of His mouth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O seed of Israel, His servant, O sons of Jacob, His chosen ones!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He [is] Jehovah our God, In all the earth [are] His judgments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember ye to the age His covenant, The word He commanded -- To a thousand generations,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which He hath made with Abraham, And His oath -- to Isaac,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He establisheth it to Jacob for a statute, To Israel -- a covenant age-during.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saying: To thee I give the land of Canaan, The portion of your inheritance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When ye are few of number, As a little thing, and sojourners in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they go up and down, From nation unto nation, And from a kingdom unto another people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hath not suffered any to oppress them, And reproveth on their account kings:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Come not against Mine anointed ones, And against My prophets do not evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sing to Jehovah, all the earth, Proclaim from day unto day His salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rehearse among nations His glory, Among all the peoples His wonders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For great [is] Jehovah, and praised greatly, And fearful He [is] above all gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all gods of the peoples [are] nought, And Jehovah the heavens hath made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Honour and majesty [are] before Him, Strength and joy [are] in His place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ascribe to Jehovah, ye families of peoples, Ascribe to Jehovah honour and strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ascribe to Jehovah the honour of His name, Lift up a present, and come before Him. Bow yourselves to Jehovah, In the beauty of holiness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be pained before Him, all the earth:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also, established is the world, It is not moved! The heavens rejoice, and the earth is glad, And they say among nations: Jehovah hath reigned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Roar doth the sea, and its fulness, Exult doth the field, and all that [is] in it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then sing do trees of the forest, From the presence of Jehovah, For He hath come to judge the earth!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give thanks to Jehovah, for good, For to the age, [is] His kindness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And say, Save us, O God of our salvation, And gather us, and deliver us from the nations, To give thanks to Thy holy name, To triumph in Thy praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed [is] Jehovah, God of Israel, From the age and unto the age;' And all the people say, `Amen,' and have given praise to Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he leaveth there before the ark of the covenant of Jehovah, for Asaph and for his brethren, to minister before the ark continually, according to the matter of a day in its day,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: both Obed-Edom and their brethren, sixty and eight, and Obed-Edom son of Jeduthun, and Hosah for gatekeepers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Zadok the priest, and his brethren the priests, before the tabernacle of Jehovah, in a high place that [is] in Gibeon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to cause to ascend burnt-offerings to Jehovah, on the altar of burnt-offering continually, morning and evening, and for all that is written in the law of Jehovah, that He charged on Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And with them [are] Heman and Jeduthun, and the rest of those chosen, who were defined by name, to give thanks to Jehovah, for to the age [is] His kindness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and with them -- Heman and Jeduthun -- [are] trumpets and cymbals for those sounding, and instruments of the song of God, and the sons of Jeduthun [are] at the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people go, each to his house, and David turneth round to bless his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it cometh to pass as David sat in his house, that David saith unto Nathan the prophet, `Lo, I am dwelling in a house of cedars, and the ark of the covenant of Jehovah [is] under curtains;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Nathan saith unto David, `All that [is] in thy heart do, for God [is] with thee.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it cometh to pass on that night that a word of God is unto Nathan, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Go, and thou hast said unto David My servant, Thus said Jehovah, Thou dost not build for Me the house to dwell in:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I have not dwelt in a house from the day that I brought up Israel till this day, and I am from tent unto tent: and from the tabernacle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whithersoever I have walked up and down among all Israel, a word spake I, with one of the judges of Israel, whom I commanded to feed My people, saying, Why have ye not built for Me a house of cedars?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And now, thus dost thou say to My servant, to David, Thus said Jehovah of Hosts, I have taken thee from the habitation, from after the sheep, to be leader over My people Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I am with thee whithersoever thou hast walked, and I cut off all thine enemies from thy presence, and have made for thee a name like the name of the great ones who [are] in the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And I have prepared a place for My people Israel, and planted it, and it hath dwelt in its place, and is not troubled any more, and the sons of perverseness add not to wear it out as at first,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yea, even from the days that I appointed judges over My people Israel. `And I have humbled all thine enemies, and I declare to thee that a house doth Jehovah build for thee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it hath come to pass, when thy days have been fulfilled to go with thy fathers, that I have raised up thy seed after thee, who is of thy sons, and I have established his kingdom,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he doth build for Me a house, and I have established his throne unto the age;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am to him for a father, and he is to Me for a son, and My kindness I turn not aside from him as I turned it aside from him who was before thee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I have established him in My house, and in My kingdom unto the age, and his throne is established unto the age.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to all these words, and according to all this vision, so spake Nathan unto David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David the king cometh in and sitteth before Jehovah, and saith, `Who [am] I, O Jehovah God, and what my house, that Thou hast brought me hitherto?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this is small in Thine eyes, O God, and Thou speakest concerning the house of thy servant afar off, and hast seen me as a type of the man who is on high, O Jehovah God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `What doth David add more unto Thee for the honour of Thy servant; and Thou Thy servant hast known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Jehovah, for Thy servant's sake, and according to Thine own heart Thou hast done all this greatness, to make known all these great things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Jehovah, there is none like Thee, and there is no god save Thee, according to all that we have heard with our ears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And who [is] as Thy people Israel, one nation in the earth whom God hath gone to ransom to Him for a people, to make for Thee a name great and fearful, to cast out from the presence of Thy people whom Thou hast ransomed out of Egypt -- nations?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yea, Thou dost appoint Thy people Israel to Thee for a people unto the age, and Thou, O Jehovah, hast been to them for God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And now, O Jehovah, the word that Thou hast spoken concerning Thy servant, and concerning his house, let be stedfast unto the age, and do as Thou hast spoken;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and let it be stedfast, and Thy name is great unto the age, saying, Jehovah of Hosts, God of Israel, is God to Israel, and the house of Thy servant David is established before Thee;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for Thou, O my God, Thou hast uncovered the ear of Thy servant -- to build to him a house, therefore hath Thy servant found to pray before Thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And now, Jehovah, Thou [art] God Himself, and Thou speakest concerning Thy servant this goodness;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and now, Thou hast been pleased to bless the house of Thy servant, to be to the age before Thee; for Thou, O Jehovah, hast blessed, and it is blessed to the age.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it cometh to pass after this, that David smiteth the Philistines, and humbleth them, and taketh Gath and its small towns out of the hand of the Philistines;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he smiteth Moab, and the Moabites are servants to David, bringing a present.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David smiteth Hadarezer king of Zobah, at Hamath, in his going to establish his power by the river Phrat,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and David captureth from him a thousand chariots, and seven thousand horsemen, and twenty thousand footmen, and David destroyeth utterly all the chariots, and leaveth of them a hundred chariots [only].
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aram of Damascus cometh in to give help to Hadarezer king of Zobah, and David smiteth in Aram twenty and two thousand men,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and David putteth [garrisons] in Aram of Damascus, and the Aramaeans are to David for servants, bearing a present, and Jehovah giveth salvation to David whithersoever he hath gone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David taketh the shields of gold that have been on the servants of Hadarezer, and bringeth them in to Jerusalem;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and from Tibhath, and from Chun, cities of Hadarezer, hath David taken very much brass; with it hath Solomon made the brazen sea, and the pillars, and the vessels of brass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Tou king of Hamath heareth that David hath smitten the whole force of Hadarezer king of Zobah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he sendeth Hadoram his son unto king David, to ask of him of peace, and to bless him (because that he hath fought against Hadarezer, and smiteth him, for a man of wars with Tou had Hadarezer been,) and all kinds of vessels, of gold, and silver, and brass;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also them hath king David sanctified to Jehovah with the silver and the gold that he hath taken from all the nations, from Edom, and from Moab, and from the sons of Ammon, and from the Philistines, and from Amalek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abishai son of Zeruiah hath smitten Edom in the valley of salt -- eighteen thousand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he putteth in Edom garrisons, and all the Edomites are servants to David; and Jehovah saveth David whithersoever he hath gone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David reigneth over all Israel, and he is doing judgment and righteousness to all his people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Joab son of Zeruiah [is] over the host, and Jehoshaphat son of Ahilud [is] remembrancer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Zadok son of Ahitub, and Abimelech son of Abiathar, [are] priests, and Shavsha [is] scribe,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Benaiah son of Jehoiada [is] over the Cherethite and the Pelethite, and the elder sons of David [are] at the hand of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it cometh to pass after this, that Nahash king of the sons of Ammon dieth, and his son reigneth in his stead,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and David saith, `I do kindness with Hanun son of Nahash, for his father did with me kindness;' and David sendeth messengers to comfort him concerning his father. And the servants of David come in unto the land of the sons of Ammon, unto Hanun, to comfort him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the heads of the sons of Ammon say to Hanun, `Is David honouring thy father, in thine eyes, because he hath sent to thee comforters? in order to search, and to overthrow, and to spy out, the land, have not his servants come in unto thee?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Hanun taketh the servants of David, and shaveth them, and cutteth their long robes in the midst, unto the buttocks, and sendeth them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And [some] go, and declare to David concerning the men, and he sendeth to meet them -- for the men have been greatly ashamed -- and the king saith, `Dwell in Jericho till that your beard is grown, then ye have returned.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Ammon see that they have made themselves abhorred by David, and Hanun and the sons of Ammon send a thousand talents of silver, to hire to them, from Aram-Naharaim, and from Aram-Maachah, and from Zobah, chariots and horsemen;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they hire to them two and thirty thousand chariots, and the king of Maachah and his people, and they come in and encamp before Medeba, and the sons of Ammon have been gathered out of their cities, and come in to the battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David heareth, and sendeth Joab, and all the host of the mighty men,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the sons of Ammon come out and set battle in array at the opening of the city, and the kings who have come [are] by themselves in the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joab seeth that the front of the battle hath been unto him, before and behind, and he chooseth out of all the choice in Israel, and setteth in array to meet Aram,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the remnant of the people he hath given into the hand of Abishai his brother, and they set in array to meet the sons of Ammon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he saith, `If Aram be stronger than I, then thou hast been to me for salvation; and if the sons of Ammon be stronger than thou, then I have saved thee;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: be strong, and we strengthen ourselves, for our people, and for the cities of our God, and Jehovah doth that which is good in His eyes.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joab draweth nigh, and the people who [are] with him, before Aram to battle, and they flee from his face;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the sons of Ammon have seen that Aram hath fled, and they flee -- they also -- from the face of Abishai his brother, and go in to the city. And Joab cometh in to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aram seeth that they have been smitten before Israel, and send messengers, and bring out Aram that [is] beyond the River, and Shophach head of the host of Hadarezer [is] before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it is declared to David, and he gathereth all Israel, and passeth over the Jordan, and cometh in unto them, and setteth in array against them; yea, David setteth in array the battle to meet Aram, and they fight with him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Aram fleeth from the face of Israel, and David slayeth of Aram seven thousand charioteers, and forty thousand footmen, and Shophach head of the host he hath put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the servants of Hadarezer see that they have been smitten before Israel, and they make peace with David and serve him, and Aram hath not been willing to help the sons of Ammon any more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it cometh to pass, at the time of the turn of the year -- at the time of the going out of the messengers -- that Joab leadeth out the force of the host, and destroyeth the land of the sons of Ammon, and cometh in and beseigeth Rabbah -- David is abiding in Jerusalem -- and Joab smiteth Rabbah, and breaketh it down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David taketh the crown of their king from off his head, and findeth it [in] weight a talent of gold, and in it a precious stone, and it is on the head of David: and spoil of the city he hath brought out very much,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the people who [are] in it he hath brought out, and setteth to the saw, and to cutting instruments of iron, and to axes; and thus doth David to all cities of the sons of Ammon, and David turneth back, and all the people, to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it cometh to pass, after this, that there remaineth war in Gezer with the Philistines, then hath Sibbechai the Hushathite smitten Sippai, of the children of the giant, and they are humbled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there is again war with the Philistines, and Elhanan son of Jair smiteth Lahmi, brother of Goliath the Gittite, the wood of whose spear [is] like a beam of weavers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there is again war in Gath, and there is a man of measure, and his fingers and his toes [are] six and six, twenty and four, and also, he hath been born to the giant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he reproacheth Israel, and smite him doth Jonathan son of Shimea, brother of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were born to the giant in Gath, and they fall by the hand of David, and by the hand of his servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there standeth up an adversary against Israel, and persuadeth David to number Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David saith unto Joab, and unto the heads of the people, `Go, number Israel from Beer-Sheba even unto Dan, and bring unto me, and I know their number.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joab saith, `Jehovah doth add to His people as they are a hundred times; are they not, my lord, O king, all of them to my lord for servants? why doth my lord seek this? why is he for a cause of guilt to Israel?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the word of the king [is] severe against Joab, and Joab goeth out, and goeth up and down in all Israel, and cometh in to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joab giveth the account of the numbering of the people unto David, and all Israel is a thousand thousand and a hundred thousand, each drawing sword, and Judah [is] four hundred and seventy thousand, each drawing sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Levi and Benjamin he hath not numbered in their midst, for the word of the king was abominable with Joab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it is evil in the eyes of God concerning this thing, and He smiteth Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and David saith unto God, `I have sinned exceedingly, in that I have done this thing; and now, cause to pass away, I pray Thee, the iniquity of Thy servant, for I have acted very foolishly.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Gad, seer of David, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Go, and thou hast spoken unto David, saying, Thus said Jehovah, Three -- I am stretching out unto thee; choose for thee one of these, and I do [it] to thee.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Gad cometh in unto David, and saith to him, `Thus said Jehovah, Take for thee --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: either for three years -- famine, or three months to be consumed from the face of thine adversaries, even the sword of thine enemies to overtake, or three days the sword of Jehovah, even pestilence in the land, and a messenger of Jehovah destroying in all the border of Israel; and now, see; what word do I return to Him who is sending me?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David saith unto Gad, `I am greatly distressed, let me fall, I pray thee, into the hand of Jehovah, for very many [are] His mercies, and into the hand of man let me not fall.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah giveth a pestilence in Israel, and there fall of Israel seventy thousand men,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and God sendeth a messenger to Jerusalem to destroy it, and as he is destroying Jehovah hath seen, and is comforted concerning the evil, and saith to the messenger who [is] destroying, `Enough, now, cease thy hand.' And the messenger of Jehovah is standing by the threshing-floor of Ornan the Jebusite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and David lifteth up his eyes, and seeth the messenger of Jehovah standing between the earth and the heavens, and his sword drawn in his hand, stretched out over Jerusalem, and David falleth, and the elders, covered with sackcloth, on their faces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David saith unto God, `Did not I -- I say to number the people? Yea, I it [is] who have sinned, and done great evil: and these, the flock, what did they? O Jehovah, my God, let, I pray Thee, Thy hand be on me, and on the house of my father, and not on Thy people -- to be plagued.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the messenger of Jehovah spake unto Gad, saying for David, `Surely David doth go up to raise an altar to Jehovah in the threshing-floor of Ornan the Jebusite.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David goeth up by the word of Gad, that he spake in the name of Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Ornan turneth back, and seeth the messenger, and his four sons [are] with him, hiding themselves, and Ornan is threshing wheat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David cometh in unto Ornan, and Ornan looketh attentively, and seeth David, and goeth out from the threshing-floor, and boweth himself to David -- face to the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David saith unto Ornan, `Give to me the place of the threshing-floor, and I build in it an altar to Jehovah; for full silver give it to me, and the plague is restrained from the people.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Ornan saith unto David, `Take to thee -- and my lord the king doth that which is good in his eyes: see, I have given the oxen for burnt-offerings, and the threshing instruments for wood, and the wheat for a present; the whole I have given.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And king David saith to Ornan, `Nay, for I surely buy for full silver; for I do not lift up that which is thine to Jehovah, so as to offer a burnt-offering without cost.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David giveth to Ornan for the place shekels of gold [in] weight six hundred;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and David buildeth there an altar to Jehovah, and offereth burnt-offerings and peace-offerings, and calleth unto Jehovah, and He answereth him with fire from the heavens on the altar of the burnt-offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith to the messenger, and he turneth back his sword unto its sheath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time when David seeth that Jehovah hath answered him in the threshing-floor of Ornan the Jebusite, then he sacrificeth there;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the tabernacle of Jehovah that Moses made in the wilderness, and the altar of the burnt-offering, [are] at that time in a high place, in Gibeon;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and David is not able to go before it to seek God, for he hath been afraid because of the sword of the messenger of Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David saith, `This is the house of Jehovah God, and this the altar for burnt-offering for Israel.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David saith to gather the sojourners who [are] in the land of Israel, and appointeth hewers to hew hewn-stones to build a house of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And iron in abundance for nails for leaves of the gates, and for couplings, hath David prepared, and brass in abundance -- there is no weighing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And cedar-trees even without number, for the Zidonians and the Tyrians brought in cedar-trees in abundance to David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David saith, `Solomon my son [is] a youth and tender, and the house to be built to Jehovah [is] to be made exceedingly great, for name and for beauty to all the lands; let me prepare, I pray Thee, for it;' and David prepareth in abundance before his death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he calleth for Solomon his son, and chargeth him to build a house to Jehovah, God of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and David saith to Solomon his son, `As for me, it hath been with my heart to build a house to the name of Jehovah my God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the word of Jehovah [is] against me, saying, Blood in abundance thou hast shed, and great wars thou hast made: thou dost not build a house to My name, for much blood thou hast shed to the earth before Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Lo, a son is born to thee; he is a man of rest, and I have given rest to him from all his enemies round about, for Solomon is his name, and peace and quietness I give unto Israel in his days;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he doth build a house to My name, and he is to Me for a son, and I [am] to him for a father, and I have established the throne of his kingdom over Israel unto the age.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Now, my son, Jehovah is with thee, and thou hast prospered, and hast built the house of Jehovah thy God, as He spake concerning thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only, Jehovah give to thee wisdom and understanding, and charge thee concerning Israel, even to keep the law of Jehovah thy God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then thou dost prosper, if thou dost observe to do the statutes and the judgments that Jehovah charged Moses with concerning Israel; be strong and courageous; do not fear, nor be cast down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And lo, in mine affliction, I have prepared for the house of Jehovah of gold talents a hundred thousand, and of silver a thousand thousand talents; and of brass and of iron there is no weighing, for in abundance it hath been, and wood and stones I have prepared, and to them thou dost add.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And with thee in abundance [are] workmen, hewers and artificers of stone and of wood, and every skilful man for every work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the gold, to the silver, and to the brass, and to the iron, there is no number; arise and do, and Jehovah is with thee.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David giveth charge to all heads of Israel to give help to Solomon his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Is not Jehovah your God with you? yea, He hath given rest to you round about, for He hath given into my hand the inhabitants of the land, and subdued hath been the land before His people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Now, give your heart and your soul to seek to Jehovah your God, and rise and build the sanctuary of Jehovah God, to bring in the ark of the covenant of Jehovah, and the holy vessels of God, to the house that is built to the name of Jehovah.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David is old, and satisfied with days, and causeth his son Solomon to reign over Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and gathereth all the heads of Israel, and the priests, and the Levites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Levites are numbered from a son of thirty years and upward, and their number, by their polls, is of mighty men thirty and eight thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of these to preside over the work of the house of Jehovah [are] twenty and four thousand, and officers and judges six thousand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and four thousand gatekeepers, and four thousand giving praise to Jehovah, `with instruments that I made for praising,' [saith David.]
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David distributeth them into courses: Of the sons of Levi: of Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the Gershonite: Laadan and Shimei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sons of Laadan: the head [is] Jehiel, and Zetham, and Joel, three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sons of Shimei [are] Shelomith, and Haziel, and Haran, three; these [are] heads of the fathers of Laadan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And sons of Shimei [are] Jahath, Zina, and Jeush, and Beriah; these [are] sons of Shimei, four.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jahath is the head, and Zizah the second, and Jeush and Beriah have not multiplied sons, and they become the house of a father by one numbering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sons of Kohath [are] Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel, four.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sons of Amram: Aaron and Moses; and Aaron is separated for his sanctifying the holy of holies, he and his sons -- unto the age, to make perfume before Jehovah, to serve Him, and to bless in His name -- unto the age.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As to Moses, the man of God, his sons are called after the tribe of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sons of Moses: Gershom and Eliezer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sons of Gershom: Shebuel the head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And sons of Eliezer are Rehabiah the head, and Eliezer had no other sons, and the sons of Rehabiah have multiplied exceedingly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sons of Izhar: Shelomith the head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sons of Hebron: Jeriah the head, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sons of Uzziel: Micah the head, and Ishshiah, the second.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi; sons of Mahli: Eleazar and Kish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Eleazar dieth, and he had no sons, but daughters, and sons of Kish their brethren take them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sons of Mushi: Mahli, and Eder, and Jerimoth, three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These [are] sons of Levi, by the house of their fathers, heads of the fathers, by their appointments, in the number of names, by their polls, doing the work for the service of the house of Jehovah, from a son of twenty years and upward,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for David said, `Jehovah, God of Israel, hath given rest to His people, and He doth tabernacle in Jerusalem unto the age;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and also of the Levites, `None [are] to bear the tabernacle and all its vessels for its service;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for by the last words of David they [took] the number of the sons of Levi from a son of twenty years and upward,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for their station [is] at the side of the sons of Aaron, for the service of the house of Jehovah, over the courts, and over the chambers, and over the cleansing of every holy thing, and the work of the service of the house of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the bread of the arrangement, and for fine flour for present, and for the thin unleavened cakes, and for [the work of] the pan, and for that which is fried, and for all [liquid] measure and [solid] measure;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to stand, morning by morning, to give thanks, and to give praise to Jehovah, and so at evening;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for all the burnt-offerings -- burnt-offerings to Jehovah for sabbaths, for new moons, and for appointed seasons, by number, according to the ordinance upon them continually, before Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they have kept the charge of the tent of meeting, and the charge of the sanctuary, and the charge of the sons of Aaron, their brethren, for the service of the house of Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to the sons of Aaron [are] their courses: sons of Aaron [are] Nadab, and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Nadab dieth, and Abihu, in the presence of their father, and they had no sons, and Eleazar and Ithamar act as priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David distributeth them, and Zadok of the sons of Eleazar, and Ahimelech of the sons of Ithamar, according to their office in their service;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there are found of the sons of Eleazar more for heads of the mighty men than of the sons of Ithamar; and they distribute them: Of the sons of Eleazar, heads for a house of fathers, sixteen; and of the sons of Ithamar, for a house of their fathers, eight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they distribute them, by lots, one with another, for princes of the sanctuary, and princes of God, have been of the sons of Eleazar, and of the sons of Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Shemaiah son of Nethaneel the scribe, of the Levites, writeth them before the king and the princes, and Zadok the priest, and Ahimelech son of Abiathar, and heads of the fathers, for priests and for Levites: one house of a father being taken possession of for Eleazar, and one being taken possession of for Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the first lot goeth out for Jehoiarib, for Jedaiah the second,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for Harim the third, for Seorim the fourth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for Malchijah the fifth, for Mijamin the sixth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for Hakkoz the seventh, for Abijah the eighth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for Jeshuah the ninth, for Shecaniah the tenth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for Eliashib the eleventh, for Jakim the twelfth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for Huppah the thirteenth, for Jeshebeab the fourteenth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for Bilgah the fifteenth, for Immer the sixteenth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for Hezir the seventeenth, for Aphses the eighteenth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for Pethahiah the nineteenth, for Jehezekel the twentieth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for Jachin the one and twentieth, for Gamul the two and twentieth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for Delaiah the three and twentieth, for Maaziah the four and twentieth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These [are] their appointments for their service, to come in to the house of Jehovah, according to their ordinance by the hand of Aaron their father, as Jehovah God of Israel, commanded them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for the sons of Levi who are left: for sons of Amram, Shubael; for sons of Shubael: Jehdeiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Rehabiah: for sons of Rehabiah, the head Ishshiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Izharite: Shelomoth; for sons of Shelomoth: Jahath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And sons of Jeriah: Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, Jekameam the fourth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sons of Uzziel: Michah; for sons of Michah: Shamir.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A brother of Michah [is] Ishshiah; for sons of Ishshiah: Zechariah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi; sons of Jaaziah: Beno;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: sons of Merari: of Jaaziah: Beno, and Shoham, and Zaccur, and Ibri.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Mahli: Eleazar, who had no sons;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for Kish: sons of Kish: Jerahmeel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And sons of Mushi [are] Mahli, and Eder, and Jerimoth; these [are] sons of the Levites, for the house of their fathers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they cast, they also, lots over-against their brethren the sons of Aaron, before David the king, and Zadok, and Ahimelech, and heads of the fathers, for priests and for Levites; the chief father over-against his younger brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David and the heads of the host separate for service, of the sons of Asaph, and Heman, and Jeduthun, who are prophesying with harps, with psalteries, and with cymbals, and the number of the workmen is according to their service.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of sons of Asaph: Zaccur, and Joseph, and Nethaniah, and Asharelah, sons of Asaph, [are] by the side of Asaph, who is prophesying by the side of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Jeduthun: sons of Jeduthun, Gedaliah, and Zeri, and Jeshaiah, Hashabiah, and Mattithiah, Shisshah, [are] by the side of their father Jeduthun; with a harp he is prophesying, for giving of thanks and of praise to Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Heman: sons of Heman: Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel, and Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti, and Romamti-Ezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, Mahazioth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all these [are] sons of Heman -- seer of the king in the things of God -- to lift up a horn; and God giveth to Heman fourteen sons and three daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these [are] by the side of their father in the song of the house of Jehovah, with cymbals, psalteries, and harps, for the service of the house of God; by the side of the king [are] Asaph, and Jeduthun, and Heman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their number, with their brethren -- taught in the song of Jehovah, all who are intelligent -- is two hundred, eighty and eight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they cause to fall lots -- charge over-against [charge], as well the small as the great, the intelligent with the learner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the first lot goeth out for Asaph to Joseph; [to] Gedaliah the second; he, and his brethren and his sons, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the third [to] Zaccur, his sons and his brethren, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the fourth to Izri, his sons and his brethren, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the fifth [to] Nethaniah, his sons and his brethren, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the sixth [to] Bukkiah, his sons and his brethren, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the seventh [to] Jesharelah, his sons and his brethren, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the eighth [to] Jeshaiah, his sons and his brethren, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the ninth [to] Mattaniah, his sons and his brethren, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the tenth [to] Shimei, his sons and his brethren, twelve:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: eleventh [to] Azareel, his sons and his brethren, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the twelfth [to] Hashabiah, his sons and his brethren, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: at the thirteenth [to] Shubael, his sons and his brethren, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: at the fourteenth [to] Mattithiah, his sons and his brethren, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: at the fifteenth [to] Jeremoth, his sons and his brethren, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: at the sixteenth [to] Hananiah, his sons and his brethren, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: at the seventeenth [to] Joshbekashah, his sons and his brethren, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: at the eighteenth [to] Hanani, his sons and his brethren, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: at the nineteenth [to] Mallothi, his sons and his brethren, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: at the twentieth [to] Eliathah, his sons and his brethren, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: at the one and twentieth [to] Hothir, his sons and his brethren, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: at the two and twentieth [to] Giddalti, his sons and his brethren, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: at the three and twentieth [to] Mahazioth, his sons and his brethren, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: at the four and twentieth [to] Romamti-Ezer, his sons and his brethren, twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the courses of the gatekeepers: of the Korhites [is] Meshelemiah son of Kore, of the sons of Asaph;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to Meshelemiah [are] sons, Zechariah the first-born, Jediael the second, Zebadiah the third, Jathniel the fourth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elam the fifth, Jehohanan the sixth, Elioenai the seventh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to Obed-Edom [are] sons, Shemaiah the first-born, Jehozabad the second, Joah the third, and Sacar the fourth, and Nethaneel the fifth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ammiel the sixth, Issachar the seventh, Peullethai the eighth, for God hath blessed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to Shemaiah his son have sons been born, who are ruling throughout the house of their father, for they [are] mighty of valour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sons of Shemaiah [are] Othni, and Rephael, and Obed, Elzabad; his brethren [are] sons of valour, Elihu and Semachiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all these [are] of the sons of Obed-Edom; they, and their sons, and their brethren, men of valour with might for service, [are] sixty and two of Obed-Edom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to Meshelemiah [are] sons and brethren, sons of valour, eighteen;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to Hosah, of the sons of Merari, [are] sons: Shimri the head (though he was not first-born, yet his father setteth him for head),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hilkiah the second, Tebaliah the third, Zechariah the fourth; all the sons and brethren of Hosah [are] thirteen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to these [are] the courses of the gatekeepers; to the heads of the mighty ones [are] charges over-against their brethren, to minister in the house of Jehovah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they cause to fall lots, as well the small as the great, according to the house of their fathers, for gate and gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the lot falleth eastward to Shelemiah; and [for] Zechariah his son -- a counsellor with understanding -- they cause to fall lots, and his lot goeth out northward:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to Obed-Edom southward, and to his sons, the house of the gatherings;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to Shuppim and to Hosah to the west, with the gate Shallecheth, in the highway, the ascent, charge over-against charge;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to the east the Levites [are] six; to the north daily four, to the south daily four, and to the gatherings two by two,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: at Parbar, to the west, [are] four at the highway, two at Parbar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the courses of the gatekeepers, of the sons of the Korhite, and of the sons of Merari.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of the Levites, Ahijah [is] over the treasures of the house of God, even for the treasures of the holy things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sons of Laadan: sons of the Gershonite, of Laadan, heads of the fathers of Laadan the Gershonite: Jehieli.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sons of Jehieli: Zetham, and Joel his brother, over the treasures of the house of Jehovah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the Amramite, for the Izharite, for the Hebronite, for the Uzzielite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Shebuel son of Gershom, son of Moses, [is] president over the treasures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his brethren, of Eliezer, [are] Rehabiah his son, and Jeshaiah his son, and Joram his son, and Zichri his son, and Shelomith his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This Shelomith and his brethren [are] over all the treasures of the holy things, that David the king, and heads of the fathers, even heads of thousands, and of hundreds, and heads of the host, sanctified;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the battles, even from the spoil they sanctified to strengthen the house of Jehovah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all that Samuel the seer, and Saul son of Kish, and Abner son of Ner, and Joab son of Zeruiah sanctified, every one sanctifying [any thing -- it is] by the side of Shelomith and his brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the Izharite, Chenaniah and his sons [are] for the outward work over Israel, for officers and for judges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the Hebronite, Hashabiah and his brethren, sons of valour, a thousand and seven hundred, [are] over the inspection of Israel, beyond the Jordan westward, for all the work of Jehovah, and for the service of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the Hebronite, Jerijah [is] the head, of the Hebronite, according to his generations, for the fathers -- in the fortieth year of the reign of David they have been sought out, and there are found among them mighty ones of valour, in Jazer of Gilead --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and his brethren, sons of valour, two thousand and seven hundred, [are] heads of the fathers, and king David appointeth them over the Reubenite, and the Gadite, and the half of the tribe of Manasseh, for every matter of God and matter of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Israel, after their number, heads of the fathers, and princes of the thousands and of the hundreds, and their officers, those serving the king in any matter of the courses, that are coming in and going out month by month, throughout all months of the year -- [are] in each course twenty and four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Over the first course, for the first month, [is] Jashobeam son of Zabdiel, and on his course [are] twenty and four thousand;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of the sons of Perez [is] the head of all princes of the hosts for the first month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over the course of the second month [is] Dodai the Ahohite, and his course, and Mikloth [is] the president, and on his course [are] twenty and four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Head of the third host, for the third month, [is] Benaiah son of Jehoiada, the head priest, and on his course [are] twenty and four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This Benaiah [is] a mighty one of the thirty, and over the thirty, and [in] his course [is] Ammizabad his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fourth, for the fourth month, [is] Asahel brother of Joab, and Zebadiah his son after him, and on his course [are] twenty and four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fifth, for the fifth month, [is] the prince Shamhuth the Izrahite, and on his course [are] twenty and four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sixth, for the sixth month, [is] Ira son of Ikkesh the Tekoite, and on his course [are] twenty and four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seventh, for the seventh month, [is] Helez the Pelonite, of the sons of Ephraim, and on his course [are] twenty and four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eighth, for the eighth month, [is] Sibbecai the Hushathite, of the Zarhite, and on his course [are] twenty and four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ninth, for the ninth month, [is] Abiezer the Antothite, of the Benjamite, and on his course [are] twenty and four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tenth, for the tenth month, [is] Maharai the Netophathite, of the Zarhite, and on his course [are] twenty and four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eleventh, for the eleventh month, [is] Benaiah the Pirathonite, of the sons of Ephraim, and on his course [are] twenty and four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The twelfth, for the twelfth month, [is] Heldai the Netophathite, of Othniel, and on his course [are] twenty and four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over the tribes of Israel: Of the Reubenite, a leader [is] Eliezer son of Zichri; of the Simeonite, Shephatiah son of Maachah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of the Levite, Hashabiah son of Kemuel; of the Aaronite, Zadok;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Judah, Elihu, of the brethren of David; of Issachar, Omri son of Michael;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Zebulun, Ishmaiah son of Obadiah; of Naphtali, Jerimoth son of Azriel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of the sons of Ephraim, Hoshea son of Azaziah; of the half of the tribe of Manasseh, Joel son of Pedaiah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of the half of Manasseh in Gilead, Iddo son of Zechariah; of Benjamin, Jaasiel son of Abner; of Dan, Azareel son of Jeroham:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: these [are] heads of the tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David hath not taken up their number from a son of twenty years and under, for Jehovah said to multiply Israel as the stars of the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joab son of Zeruiah hath begun to number -- and hath not finished -- and there is for this wrath against Israel, and the number hath not gone up in the account of the Chronicles of king David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over the treasures of the king [is] Azmaveth son of Adiel; and over the treasures in the field, in the cities, and in the villages, and in the towers, [is] Jehonathan son of Uzziah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and over workmen of the field for the service of the ground [is] Ezri son of Chelub;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and over the vineyards [is] Shimei the Ramathite; and over what [is] in the vineyards for the treasures of wine [is] Zabdi the Shiphmite;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and over the olives, and the sycamores, that [are] in the low country, [is] Baal-Hanan the Gederite; and over the treasures of oil [is] Joash;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and over the herds that are feeding in Sharon [is] Shitrai the Sharonite; and over the herds in the valleys [is] Shaphat son of Adlai;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and over the camels [is] Obil the Ishmeelite; and over the asses [is] Jehdeiah the Meronothite;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and over the flock [is] Jaziz the Hagerite; all these [are] heads of the substance that king David hath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jonathan, uncle of David, [is] counsellor, a man of understanding, he is also a scribe; and Jehiel son of Hachmoni [is] with the sons of the king;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Ahithophel [is] counsellor to the king; and Hushai the Archite [is] the friend of the king;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and after Ahithophel [is] Jehoiada son of Benaiah, and Abiathar; and the head of the host of the king [is] Joab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David assembleth all the heads of Israel, heads of the tribes, and heads of the courses who are serving the king, and heads of the thousands, and heads of the hundreds, and heads of all the substance and possessions of the king, and of his sons, with the officers and the mighty ones, even to every mighty one of valour -- unto Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David the king riseth on his feet, and saith, `Hear me, my brethren and my people, I -- with my heart -- to build a house of rest for the ark of the covenant of Jehovah, and for the footstool of our God, and I prepared to build,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and God hath said to me, Thou dost not build a house to My name, for a man of wars thou [art], and blood thou hast shed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And Jehovah, God of Israel, doth fix on me out of all the house of my father to be for king over Israel to the age, for on Judah He hath fixed for a leader, and in the house of Judah, the house of my father, and among the sons of my father, on me, [me] He hath been pleased to make king over all Israel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and out of all my sons -- for many sons hath Jehovah given to me -- He also fixeth on Solomon my son, to sit on the throne of the kingdom of Jehovah over Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saith to me, Solomon thy son, he doth build My house, and My courts, for I have fixed on him to Me for a son, and I -- I am to him for a father,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I have established his kingdom to the age, if he is strong to do My commands, and My judgments, as at this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And now, before the eyes of all Israel, the assembly of Jehovah, and in the ears of our God, keep and seek all the commands of Jehovah your God, so that ye possess this good land, and have caused your sons to inherit after you unto the age.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou, Solomon, my son, know the God of thy father, and serve Him with a perfect heart, and with a willing mind, for all hearts is Jehovah seeking, and every imagination of the thoughts He is understanding; if thou dost seek Him, He is found of thee, and if thou dost forsake Him, He casteth thee off for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, now, for Jehovah hath fixed on thee to build a house for a sanctuary; be strong, and do.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David giveth to Solomon his son the pattern of the porch, and of its houses, and of its treasures, and of its upper chambers, and of its innermost chambers, and of the house of the atonement;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the pattern of all that hath been by the Spirit with him, for the courts of the house of Jehovah, and for all the chambers round about, for the treasures of the house of God, and for the treasures of the things sacrificed;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the courses of the priests and of the Levites, and for all the work of the service of the house of Jehovah, and for all vessels of service of the house of Jehovah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even gold by weight, for [things of] gold, for all instruments of service and service; for all instruments of silver by weight, for all instruments of service and service;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and [by] weight for the candlesticks of gold, and their lamps of gold, by weight [for] candlestick and candlestick, and its lamps; and for the candlesticks of silver, by weight for a candlestick and its lamps, according to the service of candlestick and candlestick;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the gold [by] weight for tables of the arrangement, for table and table, and silver for the tables of silver;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the forks, and the bowls, and the cups of pure gold, and for the basins of gold, by weight for basin and basin, and for the basins of silver, by weight for basin and basin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the altar of perfume refined gold by weight, and for the pattern of the chariot of the cherubs of gold -- spreading and covering over the ark of the covenant of Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole [is] in writing from the hand of Jehovah, `He caused me to understand all the work of the pattern,' [said David.]
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David saith to Solomon his son, `Be strong, and courageous, and do; do not fear nor be affrighted, for Jehovah God, my God, [is] with thee; He doth not fail thee, nor forsake thee, unto the completion of all the work of the service of the house of Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And lo, courses of the priests and of the Levites [are] for all the service of the house of God; and with thee in all work [is] every willing one with wisdom, for every service; and the heads and all the people [are] according to all thy words.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David the king saith to all the assembly, `Solomon my son -- the one on whom God hath fixed -- [is] young and tender, and the work [is] great, for not for man is the palace, but for Jehovah God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and with all my power I have prepared for the house of my God, the gold for [things of] gold, and the silver for [those of] silver, and the brass for [those of] brass, the iron for [those of] iron, and the wood for [those of] wood, shoham stones, and settings, and stones of painting and of diverse colours, and all [kinds of] precious stone, and stones of white marble, in abundance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And again, because of my delighting in the house of my God, the substance I have -- a peculiar treasure of gold and silver -- I have given for the house of my God, even over and above all I have prepared for the house of the sanctuary:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: three thousand talents of gold, of the gold of Ophir, and seven thousand talents of refined silver, to overlay the walls of the houses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even gold for [things of] gold, and silver for [those of] silver, and for all the work by the hand of artificers; and who [is] he that is offering willingly to consecrate his hand to-day to Jehovah?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the heads of the fathers, and the heads of the tribes of Israel, and the heads of the thousands, and of the hundreds, even to the heads of the work of the king, offer willingly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they give for the service of the house of God, of gold -- talents five thousand, and drams a myriad; and of silver -- talents ten thousand, and of brass -- a myriad and eight thousand talents; and of iron -- a hundred thousand talents;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he with whom stones are found hath given to the treasury of the house of Jehovah, by the hand of Jehiel the Gershonite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people rejoice because of their offering willingly, for with a perfect heart they have offered willingly to Jehovah; and also David the king hath rejoiced -- great joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David blesseth Jehovah before the eyes of all the assembly, and David saith, `Blessed [art] Thou, Jehovah, God of Israel our father, from age even unto age.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Thee, O Jehovah, [is] the greatness, and the might, and the beauty, and the victory, and the honour, because of all in the heavens and in the earth; to Thee, O Jehovah, [is] the kingdom, and he who is lifting up himself over all for head;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the riches, and the honour [are] from before Thee, and Thou art ruling over all, and in Thy hand [is] power and might, and in Thy hand, to make great, and to give strength to all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And now, our God, we are giving thanks to Thee, and giving praise to Thy beauteous name;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yea, because, who [am] I, and who [are] my people, that we retain power to offer thus willingly? but of Thee [is] the whole, and out of Thy hand we have given to Thee;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for sojourners we [are] before Thee, and settlers, like all our fathers; as a shadow [are] our days on the land, and there is none abiding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `O Jehovah our God, all this store that we have prepared to build to Thee a house, for Thy holy name, [is] out of Thy hand, and of Thee [is] the whole.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And I have known, my God, that Thou art trying the heart, and uprightness dost desire; I, in the uprightness of my heart, have willingly offered all these: and now, Thy people who are found here I have seen with joy to offer willingly to Thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `O Jehovah, God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, our fathers, keep this to the age for the imagination of the thoughts of the heart of Thy people, and prepare their heart unto Thee;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to Solomon my son give a perfect heart, to keep Thy commands, Thy testimonies, and Thy statutes, and to do the whole, even to build the palace [for] which I have prepared.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David saith to all the assembly, `Bless, I pray you, Jehovah your God;' and all the assembly bless Jehovah, God of their fathers, and bow and do obeisance to Jehovah, and to the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they sacrifice to Jehovah sacrifices, and cause to ascend burnt-offerings to Jehovah on the morrow of that day, bullocks a thousand, rams a thousand, lambs a thousand, and their oblations, even sacrifices in abundance, for all Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they eat and drink before Jehovah on that day with great joy, and cause Solomon son of David to reign a second time, and anoint [him] before Jehovah for leader, and Zadok for priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Solomon sitteth on the throne of Jehovah for king instead of David his father, and prospereth, and all Israel hearken unto him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the heads, and the mighty men, and also all the sons of king David have given a hand under Solomon the king;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jehovah maketh Solomon exceedingly great before the eyes of all Israel, and putteth upon him the honour of the kingdom that hath not been on any king over Israel before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David son of Jesse hath reigned over all Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the days that he hath reigned over Israel [are] forty years; in Hebron he reigned seven years, and in Jerusalem he reigned thirty and three;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he dieth in a good old age, satisfied with days, riches, and honour, and reign doth Solomon his son in his stead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the matters of David the king, the first and the last, lo, they are written beside the matters of Samuel the seer, and beside the matters of Nathan the prophet, and beside the matters of Gad the seer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with all his reign, and his might, and the times that went over him, and over Israel, and over all kingdoms of the lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator
